derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from bark + -er The original sense was 'a person or animal that barks; noisy protestor', hence the current sense (late 17th cent.)

means.word_mean: 1. someone who stands in front of a show (as at a carnival) and gives a loud colorful sales talk to potential customers
